item.description:
JA Skinner State Park is located at the top of the Mount Holyoke Range on Rte. 47 in Hadley. For those of you not familiar with this park, it provides one of the most breathtaking views of the Pioneer Valley I have ever seen. It is also one of the top 20 destinations in the USA for viewing fall folliage. The Summit House, which was formerly a hotel in the 1900's, is now a museum. It is quaint and charming, and nice for picture taking. All and all I find this setting to be very romantic ;)

I will fashion this meetup also as a picnic. At 12:00 p.m. we can enjoy lunch together at the picnic tables. I will bring my famous rice and chicken. Members may bring a picnic type food to share with the group.
item.name: Fall Folliage Spectacular
